pullRequest.body:
See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/wiki/Tradeoffs-of-concrete-types-defined-as-subobjects for context

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.ne_zero_of_mem_circle`
`+ _root_.normSq_eq_of_mem_circle`
`+ _root_.norm_circle_smul`
`+ _root_.periodic_expMapCircle`
`+ _root_.surjOn_expMapCircle_neg_pi_pi`
`+ abs_coe`
`+ arg_exp`
`+ arg_toCircle`
`+ coeHom`
`+ coe_div`
`+ coe_expMapCircle`
`+ coe_inv`
`+ coe_inv_eq_conj`
`+ coe_mul`
`+ coe_ne_zero`
`+ coe_one`
`+ coe_toCircle`
`+ contMDiff_circleExp`
`+ exp`
`+ expHom`
`+ expMapCircle_coe`
`+ exp_add`
`+ exp_add_two_pi`
`+ exp_apply`
`+ exp_arg`
`+ exp_eq_exp`
`+ exp_neg`
`+ exp_sub`
`+ exp_sub_two_pi`
`+ exp_two_pi`
`+ exp_zero`
`+ instCoeOut`
`+ instCommGroup`
`+ instContinuousSMul`
`+ instDistribMulAction`
`+ instIsScalarTower`
`+ instMetricSpace`
`+ instMulAction`
`+ instSMul`
`+ instSMulCommClass_left`
`+ instSMulCommClass_right`
`+ instUniformSpace`
`+ instance : ChartedSpace (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1)) Circle`
`+ instance : CompactSpace Circle := Metric.sphere.compactSpace _ _`
`+ instance : ContinuousMonoidHomClass (PontryaginDual A) A Circle`
`+ instance : FunLike (PontryaginDual A) A Circle`
`+ instance : LieGroup (ùì° 1) Circle`
`+ instance : SmoothManifoldWithCorners (ùì° 1) Circle`
`+ instance : TopologicalGroup Circle := Metric.sphere.topologicalGroup`
`+ instance : UniformGroup Circle := by`
`+ invOn_arg_exp`
`+ isLocalHomeomorph_circleExp`
`+ leftInverse_exp_arg`
`+ normSq_coe`
`+ norm_smul`
`+ ofConjDivSelf`
`+ periodic_exp`
`+ smul_def`
`+ surjOn_exp_neg_pi_pi`
`+ toCircle_add`
`+ toCircle_coe`
`+ toCircle_neg`
`+ toCircle_zero`
`+ toUnits`
`+ toUnits_apply`
`++-+- toCircle`
`- Real.Angle.arg_expMapCircle`
`- Real.Angle.coe_expMapCircle`
`- Real.Angle.expMapCircle`
`- Real.Angle.expMapCircle_add`
`- Real.Angle.expMapCircle_coe`
`- Real.Angle.expMapCircle_neg`
`- Real.Angle.expMapCircle_zero`
`- abs_coe_circle`
`- circle.ofConjDivSelf`
`- circle.toUnits`
`- circle.toUnits_apply`
`- circle_def`
`- coe_div_circle`
`- coe_inv_circle`
`- coe_inv_circle_eq_conj`
`- commGroup`
`- expMapCircleHom`
`- expMapCircle_add_two_pi`
`- expMapCircle_apply`
`- expMapCircle_arg`
`- expMapCircle_eq_expMapCircle`
`- expMapCircle_sub`
`- expMapCircle_sub_two_pi`
`- expMapCircle_two_pi`
`- instance : ChartedSpace (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1)) circle`
`- instance : CompactSpace circle`
`- instance : ContinuousMonoidHomClass (PontryaginDual A) A circle`
`- instance : FunLike (PontryaginDual A) A circle`
`- instance : LieGroup (ùì° 1) circle`
`- instance : SmoothManifoldWithCorners (ùì° 1) circle`
`- instance : TopologicalGroup circle`
`- instance : UniformGroup circle := by`
`- invOn_arg_expMapCircle`
`- leftInverse_expMapCircle_arg`
`- ne_zero_of_mem_circle`
`- normSq_eq_of_mem_circle`
`- norm_circle_smul`
`- periodic_expMapCircle`
`- surjOn_expMapCircle_neg_pi_pi`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/96ff1c18-136e-4e3b-8f7e-acbf8938e0d0) for commit a4b9262113afeeafc0b945ce8e64716c5b9adfa6.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/e75a2237-5338-442f-8780-78fdc844653f/to/96ff1c18-136e-4e3b-8f7e-acbf8938e0d0) against commit 43b64af1f86ed905a33847a86af23cb91f5533c6:
```diff
  Benchmark                                         Metric         Change
  =======================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.FourierTransformDeriv   instructions    -2.6%
```
Personally, I like this change.

Oh hey Jireh. I had a question for you specifically: Your lemmas like [`unitary.spectrum_subset_circle`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/NormedSpace/Star/Spectrum.html#unitary.spectrum_subset_circle) are the only reason I didn't deprecate `circle` in favor of `Circle`. Do you think we should deprecate `circle` and change the statements of these lemmas? or leave it as the PR currently is?

Thanks for considering that. It seems we still have to stabilize on a preferred spelling for the circle as a set in the plane. Somewhere else we use `Metric.sphere`.

I'm fine if we change the statements and deprecate. Either way, we'll need a way to refer to the set, and coercing the set to a type and then back to a set is definitely not the way!
Okay, what about I leave this PR as is, and if you want to deprecate `circle` then you can change the few theorems of yours that use it in a later PR?
Okay, I'll get to it soon. If it's done before others comment on this PR, then maybe you can just deprecate here. But if this is done first, that's fine.
I'm un-requesting myself for review here - I don't know this part of the library well enough to have an informed opinion.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10367173209/job/28698006815)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10367173209/job/28698007339)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
May I ask why you are making this change? It does not seem to be necessary for the rest of the PR; and the new definition of `ZMod.toCircle` is much longer than the old one.
Looks like some merge accident

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Make `circle` a type `Circle`
